searchDocs.title: MDX Blog Post
searchDocs.content: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX. tip Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts. For example, use JSX to create an interactive button: <button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button> Click me!

searchDocs.title: Welcome
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin. Here are a few tips you might find useful. Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory. Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml. The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as: 2019-05-30-welcome.md2019-05-30-welcome/index.md A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images: The blog supports tags as well! And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.

searchDocs.title: 📌 Steps​
searchDocs.content: Go to Check List in the sidebar.Click Add Checklist.Choose whether it's: AQL or Non-AQLManual or AI-generated Fill in checklist details: Checklist NameLinked ProductChecklist TypeResponse Fields  You can also create a checklist from a product by scanning its details.

searchDocs.title: 📎 Note​
searchDocs.content: Checklists are required before assigning inspectors or creating work orders.

searchDocs.title: 🧠 What It Calculates​
searchDocs.content: Sample Size: Number of items to inspectAccept/Reject Limits: Number of defects allowedInspection Level: General or special levels

searchDocs.title: 🧾 Parameters Needed​
searchDocs.content: Lot Size (Total units in the batch)AQL Level (e.g., 1.0, 2.5)Inspection Level (Normal, Tightened, Reduced)  The calculator helps ensure your quality checks are statistically sound and industry-compliant.

searchDocs.title: 🧠 Checklist Highlights​
searchDocs.content: Manually or AI-generatedTied to individual productsSupports AQL & Non-AQL formatsReusable across work orders

searchDocs.title: 🔍 Learn More​
searchDocs.content: Create a ChecklistTypes of ChecklistsAI-Generated Checklists

searchDocs.title: 🔁 Inspection-to-Report Workflow​
searchDocs.content: Inspector starts an inspection from the assigned work orderChecklist responses and defects are submitted via the appA report is automatically generated with all resultsThe report can then be shared, commented on, and exported as PDF

searchDocs.title: 🧭 Learn More​
searchDocs.content: Performing InspectionsLogging DefectsReport GenerationShared Report Features

searchDocs.title: ⚙️ How It Works​
searchDocs.content: Select a product from the list.Click Generate Checklist using AI.The system reads: Product DescriptionTechnical Specs It then builds: Inspection InstructionsMatching Response Fields

searchDocs.title: ✨ Benefits​
searchDocs.content: Saves manual effortGenerates inspection-specific tasksCustomizable after generation  You can still manually edit any field after the AI creates it.

searchDocs.title: ❔ Can I edit a Work Order that’s already in progress?​
searchDocs.content: No. Once a Work Order is in progress, editing is locked to prevent conflicts while the inspector is working.

searchDocs.title: ❔ Can multiple inspectors be assigned to the same Work Order?​
searchDocs.content: Only one inspector can be assigned at a time.

searchDocs.title: ❔ Can I generate a checklist from a product?​
searchDocs.content: Yes! You can auto-generate a checklist from the product details using AI.

searchDocs.title: ❔ What happens if a defect is found?​
searchDocs.content: It is reported through the app with a description and image. This gets added to the final inspection report.

searchDocs.title: ❔ Who can comment on shared reports?​
searchDocs.content: Anyone who has access to the report link — typically admins, suppliers, and the assigned inspector.

searchDocs.title: 🧠 What the Report Contains​
searchDocs.content: Work Order DetailsProduct InfoInspector InfoChecklist Responses (AQL / Non-AQL)Defect Log with ImagesInspection Date & Status

searchDocs.title: 📌 Report Format​
searchDocs.content: Viewable online via the platformCan be exported as a PDFShared with other roles via the Shared Reports tab

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Steps​
searchDocs.content: Open the mobile appNavigate to assigned Work OrdersStart the inspectionFill out the checklist (AQL or Non-AQL)Log any defectsSubmit the inspection

searchDocs.title: 🔐 Rules​
searchDocs.content: Only one inspector can be assigned per work orderOnce the inspection starts, the work order status becomes in progress and cannot be edited

searchDocs.title: ✅ AQL Checklists​
searchDocs.content: Used with AQL Work OrdersInclude predefined fields like: Person NameMeasurementMedia UploadsAnnotationsSignatures

searchDocs.title: 📝 Non-AQL Checklists​
searchDocs.content: More flexibleInclude additional fields like: Response Sets (e.g. Good → Poor)Custom feedbackRating sliders    Each checklist type tailors the inspection process based on the product and quality control needs.

searchDocs.title: 🧾 Defect Info to Provide​
searchDocs.content: Description of the defectPhoto attachment (mandatory)Category/type of defectAny notes or context

searchDocs.title: 📸 Visual Evidence​
searchDocs.content: Inspectors can attach multiple images to visually document the defect.  This information is included in the generated report for transparency and auditing.

searchDocs.title: 🔧 What Inspectors Can Do​
searchDocs.content: View assigned Work OrdersAccess linked ChecklistSubmit responses + DefectsUpload media (photos, videos)Sign off and submit the report

searchDocs.title: 🧩 Defect Reporting​
searchDocs.content: Inspectors can:  Mark checklist items as failedLog defect type & descriptionAttach images or annotationsSubmit instantly to generate report    💡 The mobile app ensures inspections are fast, accurate, and paperless.

searchDocs.title: 🧩 What You Can Do​
searchDocs.content: 🔍 View the full inspection report online💬 Comment on any section of the report📥 Download the report as a PDF🔗 Share the report via a unique link

searchDocs.title: 👥 Who Can Access​
searchDocs.content: Company AdminsEmployeesSuppliers (if linked to the work order)Inspectors who conducted the inspection

searchDocs.title: 📝 Commenting​
searchDocs.content: Anyone with access to the report link can leave comments for collaboration, clarification, or follow-up actions.

searchDocs.title: 📚 What You'll Find Here​
searchDocs.content: ✅ Step-by-step tutorials to get started quickly🧠 AI-powered checklist creation explained in detail🛠️ Work order creation & inspection flows📦 Managing products, suppliers, and teams📊 Viewing and sharing reports with insights🧰 Troubleshooting and best practices

searchDocs.title: 🧭 How to Navigate​
searchDocs.content: Use the sidebar on the left to explore different sections of the documentation.  Each section is designed to be beginner-friendly yet comprehensive enough for advanced users.

searchDocs.title: 💡 Need Help?​
searchDocs.content: If you're stuck or have questions:  Check our FAQsUse the in-app helpOr contact your system administrator  Let’s get started on delivering quality inspections, powered by AI! ⚙️✨

searchDocs.title: 🧠 Product Features​
searchDocs.content: Link to SuppliersAdd technical and visual specsAuto-generate checklistsUsed in Work Orders and Reports

searchDocs.title: 🧭 Learn More​
searchDocs.content: Add a ProductProduct Form FieldsManage Existing Products

searchDocs.title: 🏬 Companies​
searchDocs.content: View active, inactive, and pending companiesApprove or reject registrationsAdd new companies via registration form

searchDocs.title: 👩‍💼 Employees​
searchDocs.content: List and register employeesSet their roles and activation status

searchDocs.title: 🕵️ Inspectors​
searchDocs.content: Register and manage internal inspectorsSet availability and activity status

searchDocs.title: 👥 My Team​
searchDocs.content: View the list of employees and team members tied to your companySee roles and assigned data

searchDocs.title: ✅ Who Can Use This?​
searchDocs.content: Only Company Admins and Super-Admins have access to the Management section.

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Steps to Add a Product​
searchDocs.content: Go to the Products tab from the sidebar.Click on Add Product.Fill out the product form (see form fields for full details).Choose a supplier from the dropdown.Upload a product image (optional).Submit to save.

searchDocs.title: 📝 Tip​
searchDocs.content: Make sure the supplier is already added in the system before linking it to the product.

searchDocs.title: 🧠 Supplier Highlights​
searchDocs.content: Add and manage supplier profilesLink suppliers to specific productsSuppliers can view & approve assigned Work OrdersAccess shared reports

searchDocs.title: 🧭 Learn More​
searchDocs.content: Add a SupplierManage Suppliers

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Steps to Add a Supplier​
searchDocs.content: Go to the Supplier tab in the sidebar.Click Add Supplier.Fill out the supplier registration form:

searchDocs.title: 📋 Fields Include​
searchDocs.content: Supplier NameSupplier Company NameContact PersonEmail & PhoneAddressCountry/Region  Submit the form to save the supplier.

searchDocs.title: 📎 Note​
searchDocs.content: Ensure supplier contact info is accurate — this will be used for notifications and report access.

searchDocs.title: 🔍 View Products​
searchDocs.content: Filter by category, company, or supplierView all product details and attachmentsLinked checklists and work orders are visible

searchDocs.title: ✏️ Edit Products​
searchDocs.content: Click the Edit icon next to a product.Update fields such as descriptions, categories, or suppliers.Save changes.  You cannot edit a product while it is being used in an active Work Order.

searchDocs.title: 🗑️ Delete Products​
searchDocs.content: Click the Delete icon.Confirm the action.Product will be removed if not linked to active data.    Keep your product list clean and updated to ensure smooth inspection operations.

searchDocs.title: 🔤 Basic Info​
searchDocs.content: Product Name: Name of the item being inspected.Model / Part No.: Product's model or part number.Customer Item No.: Identifier used by your client.Supplier Item No.: Supplier’s internal item number.

searchDocs.title: 🏷️ Categorization​
searchDocs.content: Brand: Product brand name.Product Category: High-level classification (e.g., Electronics).Sub-Category: Specific type (e.g., Mobile Phones).

searchDocs.title: 📋 Specifications​
searchDocs.content: Product Description: Brief summary of the product.Technical Specification: Details for inspection and checklist generation.

searchDocs.title: 🧾 Other​
searchDocs.content: Select Company: Company to which this product belongs.Supplier: Choose from the list of registered suppliers.Attachments: Upload product photos or documents.    These fields are critical for linking the product to checklists and inspections.

searchDocs.title: What's next?​
searchDocs.content: Read the official documentationModify your site configuration with docusaurus.config.jsAdd navbar and footer items with themeConfigAdd a custom Design and LayoutAdd a search barFind inspirations in the Docusaurus showcaseGet involved in the Docusaurus Community

searchDocs.title: 🔍 View Suppliers​
searchDocs.content: Filter by company or statusView supplier details and linked products

searchDocs.title: ✏️ Edit a Supplier​
searchDocs.content: Click the Edit icon next to the supplier.Update contact info or company name.Save changes.

searchDocs.title: 🗑️ Delete a Supplier​
searchDocs.content: Click the Delete icon.Confirm the action.Supplier will be removed only if not linked to active products or orders.

searchDocs.title: ⚠️ Best Practices​
searchDocs.content: Keep supplier information up to date.Regularly audit inactive or duplicate entries.

searchDocs.title: Create your first React Page​
searchDocs.content: Create a file at src/pages/my-react-page.js:  src/pages/my-react-page.js import React from 'react'; import Layout from '@theme/Layout'; export default function MyReactPage() { return ( <Layout> <h1>My React page</h1> <p>This is a React page</p> </Layout> ); }   A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-react-page.

searchDocs.title: Create your first Markdown Page​
searchDocs.content: Create a file at src/pages/my-markdown-page.md:  src/pages/my-markdown-page.md # My Markdown page This is a Markdown page   A new page is now available at http://localhost:3000/my-markdown-page.

searchDocs.title: Build your site​
searchDocs.content: Build your site for production:  npm run build   The static files are generated in the build folder.

searchDocs.title: Deploy your site​
searchDocs.content: Test your production build locally:  npm run serve   The build folder is now served at http://localhost:3000/.  You can now deploy the build folder almost anywhere easily, for free or very small cost (read the Deployment Guide).

searchDocs.title: Create your first Doc​
searchDocs.content: Create a Markdown file at docs/hello.md:  docs/hello.md # Hello This is my **first Docusaurus document**!   A new document is now available at http://localhost:3000/docs/hello.

searchDocs.title: Configure the Sidebar​
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus automatically creates a sidebar from the docs folder.  Add metadata to customize the sidebar label and position:  docs/hello.md --- sidebar_label: 'Hi!' sidebar_position: 3 --- # Hello This is my **first Docusaurus document**!   It is also possible to create your sidebar explicitly in sidebars.js:  sidebars.js export default { tutorialSidebar: [ 'intro', 'hello', { type: 'category', label: 'Tutorial', items: ['tutorial-basics/create-a-document'], }, ], };

searchDocs.title: Create your first Post​
searchDocs.content: Create a file at blog/2021-02-28-greetings.md:  blog/2021-02-28-greetings.md --- slug: greetings title: Greetings! authors: - name: Joel Marcey title: Co-creator of Docusaurus 1 url: https://github.com/JoelMarcey image_url: https://github.com/JoelMarcey.png - name: Sébastien Lorber title: Docusaurus maintainer url: https://sebastienlorber.com image_url: https://github.com/slorber.png tags: [greetings] --- Congratulations, you have made your first post! Feel free to play around and edit this post as much as you like.   A new blog post is now available at http://localhost:3000/blog/greetings.

searchDocs.title: 📦 Types of Work Orders​
searchDocs.content: There are two types of work orders available:

searchDocs.title: 1. Standard Work Order​
searchDocs.content: Includes basic inspection details like dates, quantity, product, and assigned inspector.Linked to a selected checklist and product.

searchDocs.title: 2. AQL Work Order​
searchDocs.content: Includes everything in a Standard Work Order, plus: 🔢 AQL Calculator (Acceptable Quality Limit)🚚 Shipment Details

searchDocs.title: 👤 Who Can Create Work Orders?​
searchDocs.content: The following user roles can create and manage work orders:  Company AdminCompany EmployeeSuper-Admin

searchDocs.title: 🔍 Work Order Workflow​
searchDocs.content: Create a new work orderAssign a checklist and an inspectorInspector performs the inspection using the mobile appSubmit results and generate a shared report

searchDocs.title: 📖 Next Steps​
searchDocs.content: Learn how to:  ➕ Add a Work Order✏️ Edit a Work Order🗑️ Delete a Work Order  Make sure your products and checklists are ready before creating a new work order.

searchDocs.title: Create a docs version​
searchDocs.content: Release a version 1.0 of your project:  npm run docusaurus docs:version 1.0   The docs folder is copied into versioned_docs/version-1.0 and versions.json is created.  Your docs now have 2 versions:  1.0 at http://localhost:3000/docs/ for the version 1.0 docscurrent at http://localhost:3000/docs/next/ for the upcoming, unreleased docs

searchDocs.title: Add a Version Dropdown​
searchDocs.content: To navigate seamlessly across versions, add a version dropdown.  Modify the docusaurus.config.js file:  docusaurus.config.js export default { themeConfig: { navbar: { items: [ { type: 'docsVersionDropdown', }, ], }, }, };   The docs version dropdown appears in your navbar:

searchDocs.title: Update an existing version​
searchDocs.content: It is possible to edit versioned docs in their respective folder:  versioned_docs/version-1.0/hello.md updates http://localhost:3000/docs/hellodocs/hello.md updates http://localhost:3000/docs/next/hello

searchDocs.title: 🔑 Role Overview​
searchDocs.content: Role	PermissionsCompany Admin	Full access to products, suppliers, work orders, checklists, reports, users Company Employee	Add/view products, suppliers, checklists, work orders, and reports Company Inspector	Use mobile app to inspect products, view assigned work orders and reports External Inspector	Similar to company inspector but limited to external assignments Supplier	View assigned work orders, approve them, and access shared reports

searchDocs.title: 🧠 Key Notes​
searchDocs.content: Only admins can manage teams and companies.Suppliers and inspectors don’t have access to the main dashboard, only the data related to their assigned work orders.

searchDocs.title: Configure i18n​
searchDocs.content: Modify docusaurus.config.js to add support for the fr locale:  docusaurus.config.js export default { i18n: { defaultLocale: 'en', locales: ['en', 'fr'], }, };

searchDocs.title: Translate a doc​
searchDocs.content: Copy the docs/intro.md file to the i18n/fr folder:  mkdir -p i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/ cp docs/intro.md i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md   Translate i18n/fr/docusaurus-plugin-content-docs/current/intro.md in French.

searchDocs.title: Start your localized site​
searchDocs.content: Start your site on the French locale:  npm run start -- --locale fr   Your localized site is accessible at http://localhost:3000/fr/ and the Getting Started page is translated.  caution In development, you can only use one locale at a time.

searchDocs.title: Add a Locale Dropdown​
searchDocs.content: To navigate seamlessly across languages, add a locale dropdown.  Modify the docusaurus.config.js file:  docusaurus.config.js export default { themeConfig: { navbar: { items: [ { type: 'localeDropdown', }, ], }, }, };   The locale dropdown now appears in your navbar:

searchDocs.title: Build your localized site​
searchDocs.content: Build your site for a specific locale:  npm run build -- --locale fr   Or build your site to include all the locales at once:  npm run build

searchDocs.title: 🧼 Deletion Rules​
searchDocs.content: Work orders can only be deleted if they are not in progress.Deletion is permanent and cannot be undone.

searchDocs.title: 🚀 How to Delete a Work Order​
searchDocs.content: Open the Work Order tab.Find the work order you wish to delete.Click the Delete icon (🗑️).Confirm the deletion when prompted.

searchDocs.title: ⚠️ Best Practice​
searchDocs.content: Only delete work orders that are truly invalid. If you're unsure, consider archiving or leaving it unassigned instead.

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ Steps to Add a Work Order​
searchDocs.content: Navigate to the Work Order tab in the sidebar.Choose between: 📦 Standard Work Order📏 AQL Work Order Click Add Work Order.Fill in the required form fields:

searchDocs.title: 📋 Form Fields​
searchDocs.content: Order No.Inspection DateExpected Shipment DateService RequestAllow Factory to Change DateOrder Quantity & UnitProduct (select from product list)Checklist (select from checklist library)Inspector (assign one)  If you're creating an AQL Work Order, the form will also include:  ✅ AQL Calculator🚚 Shipment Details

searchDocs.title: 📎 Notes​
searchDocs.content: Only one inspector can be assigned to a work order.Make sure the selected product and checklist are already created beforehand.The "Allow Factory to Change Date" toggle enables flexibility if scheduling is uncertain.

searchDocs.title: 🔐 Edit Permissions​
searchDocs.content: You can only edit a work order before it is in progress. Once an inspector begins working on it, editing is disabled to maintain data integrity.

searchDocs.title: 🛠️ How to Edit a Work Order​
searchDocs.content: Go to the Work Order tab.Locate the work order you want to modify.Click the Edit icon (✏️) next to the work order entry.Modify the necessary fields: DatesQuantityAssigned InspectorChecklist/Product Click Save Changes.

searchDocs.title: ❗ Important​
searchDocs.content: If a work order is in progress or completed, editing will be locked. To make changes, you must cancel and recreate the work order.

searchDocs.title: Front Matter​
searchDocs.content: Markdown documents have metadata at the top called Front Matter:  my-doc.md --- id: my-doc-id title: My document title description: My document description slug: /my-custom-url --- ## Markdown heading Markdown text with [links](./hello.md)

searchDocs.title: Links​
searchDocs.content: Regular Markdown links are supported, using url paths or relative file paths.  Let's see how to [Create a page](/create-a-page).   Let's see how to [Create a page](./create-a-page.md).   Result: Let's see how to Create a page.

searchDocs.title: Images​
searchDocs.content: Regular Markdown images are supported.  You can use absolute paths to reference images in the static directory (static/img/docusaurus.png):  ![Docusaurus logo](/img/docusaurus.png)     You can reference images relative to the current file as well. This is particularly useful to colocate images close to the Markdown files using them:  ![Docusaurus logo](./img/docusaurus.png)

searchDocs.title: Code Blocks​
searchDocs.content: Markdown code blocks are supported with Syntax highlighting.  ```jsx title="src/components/HelloDocusaurus.js" function HelloDocusaurus() { return <h1>Hello, Docusaurus!</h1>; } ```   src/components/HelloDocusaurus.js function HelloDocusaurus() { return <h1>Hello, Docusaurus!</h1>; }

searchDocs.title: Admonitions​
searchDocs.content: Docusaurus has a special syntax to create admonitions and callouts:  :::tip[My tip] Use this awesome feature option ::: :::danger[Take care] This action is dangerous :::   My tip Use this awesome feature option  Take care This action is dangerous

searchDocs.title: MDX and React Components​
searchDocs.content: MDX can make your documentation more interactive and allows using any React components inside Markdown:  export const Highlight = ({children, color}) => ( <span style={{ backgroundColor: color, borderRadius: '20px', color: '#fff', padding: '10px', cursor: 'pointer', }} onClick={() => { alert(`You clicked the color ${color} with label ${children}`) }}> {children} </span> ); This is <Highlight color="#25c2a0">Docusaurus green</Highlight> ! This is <Highlight color="#1877F2">Facebook blue</Highlight> !     This is Docusaurus green !  This is Facebook blue !
